Detailed Description

Simulation class.

Author:
Lee Netherton
The Sim class acts as a continer for the entire simulation. The following functions are called whils the simulation is running:
  • init_cond( )
  • update( )
  • derivative( )
  • output( )
  • terminate( ) (see inividual functions for their uses)
Simulation inputs, ouputs, states, and parameter vectors are accessed via Interface classes. These Interface classes are instantiated and kept in an InterfaceContainer class. New interfaces can be registered with the InterfaceContainer class.

The Exception class can be used to flag exeptions. The Exception::kill() function will stop the simulation and print the exeption that caused it to the screen.
